00024 
00025 #ifndef _SYX_BYTECODE_H
00026 #define _SYX_BYTECODE_H
00027 
00028 #include "syx-types.h"
00029 #include "syx-object.h"
00030 #include "syx-memory.h"
00031 
00032 SYX_BEGIN_DECLS
00033 
00042 #define SYX_BYTECODE_BITS 16
00043 
00045 #define SYX_BYTECODE_MAX ((1 << SYX_BYTECODE_BITS) - 1)
00046 
00048 #define SYX_BYTECODE_COMMAND_BITS 5
00049 
00050 #define SYX_BYTECODE_COMMAND_MAX ((1 << SYX_BYTECODE_COMMAND_BITS) - 1)
00051 
00052 #define SYX_BYTECODE_COMMAND_MASK (SYX_BYTECODE_COMMAND_MAX << (SYX_BYTECODE_BITS - SYX_BYTECODE_COMMAND_BITS))
00053 
00055 #define SYX_BYTECODE_ARGUMENT_BITS (SYX_BYTECODE_BITS - SYX_BYTECODE_COMMAND_BITS)
00056 
00057 #define SYX_BYTECODE_ARGUMENT_MAX ((1 << SYX_BYTECODE_ARGUMENT_BITS) - 1)
00058 
00059 #define SYX_BYTECODE_ARGUMENT_MASK (SYX_BYTECODE_ARGUMENT_MAX)
00060 
00061 extern syx_symbol syx_bytecode_unary_messages[];
00062 extern syx_symbol syx_bytecode_binary_messages[];
00063 
00064 #define SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE(name,arg)             \
00065   INLINE void syx_bytecode_ ## name (SyxBytecode *bytecode, arg)
00066 
00067 typedef struct SyxBytecode SyxBytecode;
00068 
00070 struct SyxBytecode {
00072   syx_uint16 code[SYX_BYTECODE_MAX + 1];
00073   syx_uint16 code_top;
00075   SyxOop literals[SYX_BYTECODE_MAX + 1];
00076   syx_uint16 literals_top;
00077 
00079   syx_int32 stack_size;
00080 };
00081 
00082 EXPORT extern SyxBytecode *syx_bytecode_new (void);
00083 
00089 INLINE void
00090 syx_bytecode_free (SyxBytecode *bytecode)
00091 {
00092   syx_free (bytecode);
00093 }
00094 
00095 EXPORT extern void syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (SyxBytecode *bytecode, syx_uint8 high, syx_uint16 low);
00096 EXPORT extern void syx_bytecode_gen_message (SyxBytecode *bytecode, syx_bool to_super, syx_uint32 argument_count, syx_symbol selector);
00097 EXPORT extern syx_uint32 syx_bytecode_gen_literal (SyxBytecode *bytecode, SyxOop literal);
00098 
00100 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (gen_code, syx_uint16 value)
00101 {
00102   bytecode->code[bytecode->code_top++] = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_16 (value);
00103 }
00104 
00106 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (do_special, SyxBytecodeSpecial special)
00107 {
00108   syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_DO_SPECIAL, special);
00109 }
00110 
00113 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (push_array, syx_uint16 num_elements)
00114 {
00115   syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_PUSH_ARRAY, num_elements);
00116   bytecode->stack_size++;
00117 }
00118 
00120 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (push_argument, syx_uint16 argument_index)
00121 {
00122   syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_PUSH_ARGUMENT, argument_index);
00123   bytecode->stack_size++;
00124 }
00125 
00127 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (push_temporary, syx_uint16 temporary_index)
00128 {
00129   syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_PUSH_TEMPORARY, temporary_index);
00130   bytecode->stack_size++;
00131 }
00132 
00134 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (push_literal, SyxOop instance)
00135 {
00136   syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_PUSH_LITERAL,
00137                                 syx_bytecode_gen_literal (bytecode, instance));
00138   bytecode->stack_size++;
00139 }
00140 
00142 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (push_block_closure, SyxOop closure)
00143 {
00144   syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_PUSH_BLOCK_CLOSURE,
00145                                 syx_bytecode_gen_literal (bytecode, closure));
00146   bytecode->stack_size++;
00147 }
00148 
00150 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (push_instance, syx_uint16 instance_index)
00151 {
00152   syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_PUSH_INSTANCE, instance_index);
00153   bytecode->stack_size++;
00154 }
00155 
00157 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (push_constant, SyxBytecodeConstant constant)
00158 {
00159   syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_PUSH_CONSTANT, constant);
00160   bytecode->stack_size++;
00161 }
00162 
00164 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (push_binding_variable, SyxOop assoc)
00165 {
00166   syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_PUSH_BINDING_VARIABLE,
00167                                 syx_bytecode_gen_literal (bytecode, assoc));
00168   bytecode->stack_size++;
00169 }
00170 
00172 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (assign_temporary, syx_uint16 temporary_index)
00173 {
00174   syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_ASSIGN_TEMPORARY, temporary_index);
00175 }
00176 
00178 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (assign_instance, syx_uint16 instance_index)
00179 {
00180   syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_ASSIGN_INSTANCE, instance_index);
00181 }
00182 
00184 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (assign_binding_variable, SyxOop link)
00185 {
00186   syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_ASSIGN_BINDING_VARIABLE,
00187                                 syx_bytecode_gen_literal (bytecode, link));
00188 }
00189 
00195 SYX_FUNC_BYTECODE (duplicate_at, syx_int32 index)
00196 {
00197   syx_uint16 instruction = (SYX_BYTECODE_DO_SPECIAL << SYX_BYTECODE_ARGUMENT_BITS) + SYX_BYTECODE_DUPLICATE;
00198   memmove (bytecode->code + index + 1, bytecode->code + index, SYX_BYTECODE_MAX - index);
00199   bytecode->code[index] = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_16 (instruction);
00200   bytecode->code_top++;
00201   bytecode->stack_size++;
00202 }
00203 
00205 INLINE void
00206 syx_bytecode_pop_top (SyxBytecode *bytecode)
00207 {
00208   syx_bytecode_do_special (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_POP_TOP);
00209 }
00210 
00211 SYX_END_DECLS
00212 
00213 #endif /* _SYX_BYTECODE_H */
